result.execSummary:
The defendant Lachelle N Emerson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at the rate of $25.00 per month commencing 11/01/2016 or penalty of 2 days Jail for non-payment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lachelle N Emerson

Defendant Lachelle N Emerson in court with attorney Graber for Tedia K. Gamino.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to amend charges to a county ordinance theft.   Defendant pleads no contest to amended count. Court on its own motion amends the charge to a county ordinance DC instead of Theft.   Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Graber makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  

Court orders the following:  

FORFEITURE:  $267.50 to be paid at a rate of $25.00 a month commencing 11/1/2016.  Failure to pay will result in 2 days jail.
Jury status hearing on October 13, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on October 18, 2016 at 08:30 am.
